title: Rotational kinematics average velocity of bar

content.question: A long bar rotates about an axis that is perpendicular to the bar and located at its center. The angular velocity of the bar in <math alttext="radians per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math> is given by <math alttext="omega, open parenthesis, t, close parenthesis, equals 4 times t squared plus 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>ω</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is the time in seconds. Which of the following approaches could be used to find the average angular velocity of the bar in the time interval <math alttext="1 is less than or equal to t, which is less than or equal to 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>3</mn></math>?

choices.label: Evaluate <math alttext="omega, open parenthesis, 2, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>ω</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Evaluate <math alttext="omega, open parenthesis, 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>ω</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="omega, open parenthesis, 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>ω</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Take the average of the two values.

Evaluate the derivative <math alttext="the fraction d omega over d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>ω</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="t equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mstyle></math>. Multiply the result by <math alttext="delta t equals 2 s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>.

Evaluate the integral <math alttext="the integral from 1 to 3 of omega, open parenthesis, t, close parenthesis, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></munderover><mi>ω</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mstyle></math>. Divide the result by <math alttext="delta t equals 2 s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>.

content.answer: Evaluate the integral <math alttext="the integral from 1 to 3 of omega, open parenthesis, t, close parenthesis, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><munderover><mo>∫</mo><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></munderover><mi>ω</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mstyle></math>. Divide the result by <math alttext="delta t equals 2 s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
